image.altText: A tin roof falling off the top of a building next to a fire truck.

props.synopsis: Five people are dead including a nine-year-old girl who got lost inside a storm drain in Brisbane's south as severe storms lashed Australia's east coast.Â

title.children: Girl lost in storm drain found dead, as storms and floods across Australia's east coast kill at least five people

image.altText: A train decorated with Christmas lights drives along the street.

props.synopsis: The K-Town Express Christmas train was an impressive sight as it rumbled down the streets of the Northern Territory town as it took visitors and locals on tours to see Christmas light displays.

title.children: Katherine jumps aboard festive spirit with decked out Christmas train rides

image.altText: Emergency crews are stationed next to Penrith Beach.

props.synopsis: A missing swimmer's body has been found by emergency services at the newly-opened Penrith Beach in Sydney's west following reports he fell off a paddleboard and failed to resurface.

title.children: Emergency services discover missing swimmer's body at the newly-opened Penrith Beach

image.altText: A group of workers in high vis pose smiling in front of machinery from a rocket

props.synopsis: The first locally made rocket to be launched into space from Australian soil is scheduled for lift-off from a commercial facility in Queensland early next year.

title.children: An Australian-made rocket will be launched in Queensland in a historic first

image.altText: A woman holding a baby

props.synopsis: Despite a global surge in women freezing their eggs, nearly 9 out of 10 Victorians aren't returning to use their stored eggs. Advocates say more education could change what happens to them next.

title.children: More women are freezing their eggs. But what happens if they don't get used?

image.altText: A boat making its way through waves

props.synopsis: Andoo Comanche is leading late on day one of the Sydney to Hobart, but one of its main challengers may have hit trouble, with SHK Scallywag losing ground.

title.children: Sydney to Hobart race favourite SHK Scallywag one of the first casualties as Andoo Comanche takes the lead

image.altText: Side by side photos of Mary-Louise McLaws, Father Bob Maguire and Barry Humphries dressed as Dame Edna

props.synopsis: From master chefs and iconic artists to sporting legends and trailblazing politicians, Australia lost some of its most loved â and most controversial â icons this year.

title.children: Australia lost some of its most loved sporting legends and creative minds this year

image.altText: An illustration in blue and pink colours shows a woman sitting alone in a room looking out a window

props.synopsis: Long COVID is not just destroying people's health. Behind closed doors, in homes across Australia and abroad, it is irreversibly changing relationshipsÂ â sometimes for the better, too often for worse.

title.children: 'I grieve the person who I used to be': The debilitating illness straining marriages until they crack

image.altText: A man in a shirt and jeans rides in bicycle along a bridge during the day in a Medieval-looking city.

props.synopsis: What can Australia learn from other cities reducing CBD traffic? It's about disincentives for drivers and incentives for those who choose other means of getting around.

title.children: Can we cut out cars in our cities? This Belgian city did

image.altText: A woman in green shirt working at computer.

props.synopsis: Georgie Morse sees her ability to hyper focus on gardening tasks as a benefit of her attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder. But, ADHD has cost her in other ways â with calls for business to show understanding to people with the condition.

title.children: Georgie racked up $2,000 in parking fines, an experience she attributes to 'ADHD tax'

image.altText: Psychiatrist Dr Jerry Gelb avoided jail after taking a handgun into the Melbourne Magistrate's Court

props.synopsis: During the COVID-19 pandemic, Victoria's justice system experienced the biggest backlog of cases in the country, but things are returning to normal.

title.children: It's taken three years for Victoria's courts to clear a backlog and return to pre-pandemic levels

image.altText: Two people in remote community lean on bonnet of lime green sedan

props.synopsis: Once part of the fabric of the Australian automotive landscape, the Holden Commodore and Ford Falcon have now mostly been ditched for newer and flashier models, but the iconic rigs still have devoted fans in remote communities.

title.children: Increasingly considered relics in cities, Commodores and Falcons still get hearts revving in the bush

image.altText: Rusting cars with smashed windscreens among tropical palms.

props.synopsis: How does a pristine tropical island manage decades of rubbish? For one of Australia's most remote territories, it can be an expensive ordeal.

title.children: What does a pristine tropical island do with decades worth of dumped cars?

image.altText: A grey navy ship on the water with land in the background.

props.synopsis: Russia says two Ukrainian fighter jets were destroyed by anti-aircraft fire during the attack, however Ukraine has denied this claim.Â

title.children: Russia says naval ship in Crimea was damaged in airstrike by Ukrainian forces

image.altText: An Israeli soldier rides in an armoured personnel carrier in Gaza.

props.synopsis: The Israeli defence minister says Lebanon, Syria, Iraq, and Yemen among possible locations in which actions have been taken.

title.children: Israel hints that it has retaliatorily struck international targets

image.altText: Pakistan bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi puts his hands to his mouth after bowling to Australia batter Usman Khawaja.

props.synopsis: Whether it's within an over or a session, Australia's batters are able to simply wait out the good stuff from Pakistan, safe in the knowledge the pressure will be released before too long.

title.children: Touring Pakistan needs to learn from its hosts, even if it's boring sometimes

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne chases pigeons

props.synopsis: Pakistan dropped catches, David Warner offered them up and the crowd celebrated Shane Warne's fabulous legacy on Boxing Day at the MCG. Here are the five quick hits from day one.

image.altText: Julian McLennan standing with his friends and holding his surfboard, which has shark bite marks.

props.synopsis: Julian McLennan was enjoying a Christmas Day surf near Taree when he felt something grab his leg, only to across to see a "massive fin" come out of the water.

title.children: Teen's lucky escape after shark bite during Christmas Day surf

image.altText: A woman in a pink jumper holds a bunch of toilet paper rolls

props.synopsis: As we enter the festive season it's a good time to think about what all those celebratory alcoholic drinks can do to your gut, writes Vincent Ho.

title.children: Why does alcohol make my poo go weird?

image.altText: A plane taking off from the tarmac

props.synopsis: Following an anonymous tip-off, French authorities grounded a plane to conduct investigations over four days which affected 303 passengers.

title.children: Flight grounded for four days in France, amid human trafficking concerns, flies to India

image.altText: a police car and van and police tape next to a house

props.synopsis: A woman in her 30s dies after being found with serious injuries in the Kimberley town, while a man assists police with their inquiries.

title.children: Homicide detectives investigate woman's death in Broome on Christmas night

image.altText: A smiling man lays on a hospital bed with a moon boot on his right leg and foot.

props.synopsis: A wing foiler tells of the moment he came off his board and fell on a shark which promptly latched onto his leg at Wedge Island, north of Perth.

title.children: 'I fell straight into its mouth': Wing foiler bitten on leg by shark north of Perth relives encounter

image.altText: A young girl wearing a spacesuit costume and helmet stands in a field of purple flowers under an overcast sky

title.children: Tired of baking sourdough, this Melbourne family began an unusual lockdown project â that went viral

image.altText: A man playing ice hockey

props.synopsis: When Adam Johnson died during an ice hockey match earlier this year, his club called it a "freak accident". Now police are investigating whether another player could have been criminally responsible.

title.children: A player's brutal death on the ice hockey rink has left a UK team devastated and police in tricky territory

image.altText: Boxing Day sales 2023 Melbourne 2023-12-26 11:12:00

props.synopsis: Despite cost-of-living pressures, Aussies are expected to spend more than they did at last year's Boxing Day Sales.Â

title.children: Australians tipped to spend $23.9 billion as thousands flock to Boxing Day Sales

image.altText: People working in an old style General Store

props.synopsis: The general store at Cumnock in western New South Wales has had five owners over its 141-year history. Now it has a sixth: the town itself.

title.children: Small town buys 141-year-old general store to save it from closure

image.altText: A woman sits on the floor, leaning against a couch, using a laptop

props.synopsis: It may not be enough simply to be physically away from work, particularly in an era when so many of us work from home. We also have to stop thinking about work when we're not there, writes Jane Gifkins.

title.children: The secret to switching off from work lies in learning the art of detachment

image.altText: A tall man and a woman walking along a dusty road

props.synopsis: From dusty farming communities to sleepy seaside towns, crime fiction set in regional Australia is taking off. Here's why readers are devouring these stories.

title.children: 'A narrow world': Why a small country town is the perfect setting for crime fiction
